pr_title: Fix script statistics flaky test case

timeline.bodyText:
Why we need OR condition why not just
(int)(nodeStats.get(0).get(StatNames.SCRIPT_COMPILATIONS.getName())) == initialScriptCompilations + 1)
timeline.author: vamshin

replies.bodyText:
Yes, this was an attempted workaround. SCRIPT_COMPILATIONS will only be incremented if the script has yet to be compiled.
A better solution would be to clear the script cache before running the tests so that it is guaranteed that the script gets recompiled and SCRIPT_COMPILATIONS gets incremented by 1. I will update the PR.
replies.author: jmazanec15

timeline.author: vamshin

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is what causes cache to evict the script. Here is documentation: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.x/modules-scripting-using.html#modules-scripting-using-caching
replies.author: jmazanec15
